thread.title: What would a 13,000 year old man know that we do not? Find out October 15th
thread.title_full: What would a 13,000 year old man know that we do not? Find out October 15th - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: What would a 13,000 year old man know that we do not? Find out October 15th
text:
Tamara Veitch DeFazio and Rene DeFazio
Award winning author duo weaves current archeological discoveries and ancient historical theories exploring an alternative world history in the trilogy: "The Great Year Series"
WHITE ROCK, British Columbia , Oct. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- With their first book receiving awards in both London and New York , and optioned by Hollywood producers within weeks of its release, married writing team Tamara Veitch DeFazio and Rene DeFazio are focused on the final edits of their second book: One Great Year: The Ancient Book of Changes set for release on Valentine's Day 2016.
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151014/276736
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151014/276737
The first book in the series: One Great Year is described by Meg Robinson , author of Drawn by a Star as "Indiana Jones meets Eckhart Tolle" and "a turning point in the collective psyche…"
The authors are discounting the digital version of One Great Year on Amazon October 15 th and October 16 th so fans have an opportunity to share the book with friends, and new readers can catch up before the release of the next book. On those days, the authors will be available through social media to answer questions and interact with fans.
The concept of the Great Year is based on documentation from more than 31 ancient civilizations, tracking the Earth through a 26,000 year cycle as it slowly wobbles on its axis; something NASA refers to as "the period of one complete cycle of the equinoxes around the ecliptic," and Plato called the "Perfect Year." History correlates the rise and fall of human consciousness through the ages with this same cycle. Using this as the unifying theme, the authors also reference philosophies and archaeological sites they researched for 3 ½ years before writing the first book, including:
the pyramids and compound at Tiahuanaco in Bolivia the discovery of a highly advanced civilization estimated to be more than 11,000 years old at Gobekli Tepi in Turkey the Indian Sanskrit Vedas the life and legends surrounding Genghis Khan in the Book of Mongols and for the sequel, The I Ching of China . This knowledge is woven into an epic love story and adventure consciousness novel that is an unforgettable tale of power, devotion, lust, and spirituality. For readers who want to dig deeper into this information, the authors provide a comprehensive bibliography and resource list at the end of the book.
About the Authors:
Born and raised in the Vancouver area, Rene DeFazio is an actor, screenwriter and producer with numerous film and television roles to his credit, as well as countless commercials and print ads. After spending many years backpacking and filming, Rene drew upon an abundance of unusual and exciting experiences to create One Great Year . His tireless research and firsthand knowledge of exotic locations, customs, sights and smells helped to bring this story to life. Rene was awarded an "Empowered Writers Award" at the 2014 World International Peace festival in Vancouver .
Tamara Veitch was also awarded an "Empowered Writers Award" at the 2014 World International Peace festival in Vancouver . Since an early age Tamara knew that she was a writer. She studied English and General Arts at Simon Fraser University and has had articles published in Guided Synergy Magazine , Awareness Magazine ( Southern California ), and Mosaic Magazine . Tamara is an experienced mural artist, teacher, public speaker and currently teaches creative writing to children ages 8-14 in her local community as well as touring and presenting the groundbreaking research and discoveries behind her novels.
Contact Information:
